posts.post_content: I've actually found this card to be quite good. Combo it with offensive enchantments that may easily die like [Illusionary Terrain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Illusionary Terrain), [Mana Chains](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Chains), or [Dance of Many](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dance of Many)... I use that in a blue/white control deck that's quite effective. Not bad with [Mystic Remora](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mystic Remora) too.

Posted By: Gesepp (8/19/2010 7:38:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Hell, it's not so bad. Keep getting back [seal of doom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=seal of doom) to lock down creatures. [Grand architect](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grand architect) can help the costs and turn things blue for you, so the seal can hit anything. Guess you need [liquimetal coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=liquimetal coating) to, to make them artifacts first. Throw in a [Memnarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnarch) and [academy ruins](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=academy ruins) and you have yourself a cool casual control deck.

Posted By: endersblade (10/18/2012 8:25:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@tenkaze  
Not true. Not everything is good in EDH. For example, everything that would be good in a normal constructed aggro deck is mediocre at best, and generally weak. Direct damage and point removal are okay, but not nearly as good as board sweepers. Between the larger life totals lengthening the game, the extra mana that a lengthy game allows, and the fact that 1-for-1 trades bare bad in multiplayer games, EDH winds up as a completely different beast.
posts.html:
@tenkaze
Not true. Not everything is good in EDH. For example, everything that would be good in a normal constructed aggro deck is mediocre at best, and generally weak. Direct damage and point removal are okay, but not nearly as good as board sweepers. Between the larger life totals lengthening the game, the extra mana that a lengthy game allows, and the fact that 1-for-1 trades bare bad in multiplayer games, EDH winds up as a completely different beast.
